title: Aregato - ADA ebook marketplace
description: Ebooks market is highly centralized, censored, and dominated by Amazon Kindle. There is a general lack of marketplaces in the crypto world

f6_assessments.q0: The ebook market can definitely benefit with a crypto maketplace. This project has the potential to scale and benefit a huge community. Driving more people to use Cardano. To be resilient to future challenges and to incorporate all the features you mentioned it would be beneficial to turn this project into a DAO. That would make it a true decentralized marketplace and even more attractive to potential active community members.
f6_assessments.q1: Proposal needs more team members to contribute to the plan on building this marketplace. Seeing an already established committed team with links to showcase their experience will boost confidence in CAs and voters. Also showing of prototypes of UI design and budget allocation will increase feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal is a prototype and I believe if it gains more active team members the roadmap and milestones will become clear. Potential risks and challenges needs to be considered as well. How would you address fake profiles? and people posting someone else's work as their own. If this was a DOA, you can incentivize people for addressing these issues. Therefore attracting more active community members. Don't give up on this project. Find the necessary team members and keep refining your plan. Good luck.

f6_assessments.q0:
As an author, developer and entrepreneur myself, I like the idea of a decentralized book marketplace. But the solution lacks a clear, measurable and feasible plan to make it happen, so I cannot agree neither disagree that it can address the challenge. I suggest you work on the HOW you will make it happen, providing a timeline (3, 6, 12 months) with intended deliverables. A budget breakdown with realistic estimates, to develop the platform, but also to take the platform to the market (How are you going to get authors? How are you going to get buyers? Solving the chicken and the egg problem is key for any platform, so that go to market strategy should be part of your proposal to understand its feasibility). I believe the amount requested is rather low for such a project which makes me doubt on the potential success of it as it is presented.
If the proposal does not get funded, I suggest you work on the details and present it at next funding round, as I think with the proper plan you could have a great platform with great impact for the cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is no detailed plan presented, neither clear deliverables. No budget breakdown was provided, nor the strategy, team composition, efforts and key metrics so I have to disagree this proposal could be implemented successfully as it is.
As I said before I do like the idea, I watched your video and you seem very passionate about Cardano and your Idea, so I encourage you to pursue it, look for help within the community, I guess there are many fellows with the same passion for books that can help you out to create a feasible plan and a great product.
f6_assessments.q2: No Key metrics, nor deliverables, neither budget breakdown were provided. So I strongly disagree that the proposal as it is can be audited.

f6_assessments.q0: Amazon Kindle having a monopoly on the market is indeed a problem worth taking a look at and you're core idea is effective. Nonetheless, it is difficult and ambitious to fight this on your own. Let alone with funding of $10000. A question that pops up in my head is how plausible is the dApp going to provide high numbers/growth to the platform. Creating a marketplace for E-books is a good idea but why do you include all the extra features? I would focus on the core of the proposal and not included all the extra features. This way you can make a better proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer says that he has experience in publishing en writing books but does not provide the necessary links to back up this statement. The plan described is not really a plan but a detailed explanation of the idea itself and possible hint to extra features. I would've like to see a full debriefing about how you plan to implement this idea and how you want to bring it to life. What do you need to make this proposal work(developers, market research,...). Since there is no funding breakdown of timetable we are left with empty words on how this is going to work. For what do you need funding, when do you see yourself starting on the project and how do you plan to move forward. The biggest issue I have with the proposal is that you have already participated in Fund3 and that nothing has changed since then. The only thing you changed in the proposal is your years of experience and the funding budget. Given this, I strongly disagree that this will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: For auditability, there just isn't enough information to make an assessment. We are missing roadmap, KPI's, milestones and a budget breakdown. How many people will you need to develop this? I would suggest going for a smaller proposal and focus on one aspect and work out the missing pieces of information.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem suggested is that there is a need for a Cardano based Dapp that would offer a decentralised marketplace for e-books. This I would think is a valid idea, unfortunately, at present this proposal is the idea stage. Many good ideas that need further work and collaboration to be developed into a solid proposal. I would recommend the proposer seek out Catalyst community to form these collaborations and further develop their ideas.
f6_assessments.q1: Very difficult to assess the experience of the proposer without examples of work. It is stated that they have published e-books but they have not provided any links to verify. Therefore, it is difficult to gauge the likelihood of the proposal being implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: Great idea and some interesting concepts but simply insufficient information to be able to verify the author's claims. The budget lacks any sort of breakdown and so it is difficult to know what we are actually assessing in terms of measurable outcomes. I would highly recommend the author seek out other teams with the Catalyst space and through collaboration drive their many ideas further.

solution: Aregato - ebook marketplace with blogging and social media features, built on top of Cardano, with Cardano native assets and NFTs
experience: Apart from 5 years in blockchain (research, marketing, content) I wrote, published several books (in print, as ebooks) so I know this area
